originalTitle: Son of Robert Mugabe arrested in South Africa on suspicion of attempted murder
title: Son of Robert Mugabe arrested in South Africa on suspicion of attempted murder
content: Bellarmine Mugabe is in custody after a man who worked at the place where he was staying was shot and injured.

title: Islamist militants accused of killing 34 in raids on Nigerian villages
content: The gunmen launched simultaneous assaults on multiple communities in a remote border district, officials say.

title: Sudan atrocities are 'hallmarks of genocide', UN says

title: Files reveal Epstein was offered chance to buy US Pentagon, FBI buildings
content: New files show Epstein, who had close ties to Israel, was offered sensitive US government real estate deals.

title: Kenyan families demand return of loved ones recruited into Russian army
content: Official intelligence report revealed that more than 1,000 citizens had been lured to fight for Russia in Ukraine.

title: Masked protesters arrested outside Trump’s Board of Peace meeting
content: Pro-Palestinian protesters gathered in downtown Washington, DC, outside Donald Trump’s Board of Peace event.

title: Trump says world has 10 days to see if Iran deal reached

title: Trump's Board of Peace members pledge $7bn in Gaza relief
content: Trump said it "looks like" Hamas will disarm, even though there are signs the group is regrouping.

originalTitle: 'Anyone found guilty of racism should not be in the game'
title: 'Anyone found guilty of racism should not be in the game'
content: Chelsea head coach Liam Rosenior says anyone found guilty of racist behaviour in football "shouldn't be in the game".

originalTitle: The eerie similarities between Arsenal's 2007-8 collapse and now
title: The eerie similarities between Arsenal's 2007-8 collapse and now
content: Arsenal's disappointing 2-2 draw at Wolves on Wednesday has similarities to what happened to the Gunners 18 years ago.

originalTitle: Women's FA Cup revamp on hold after 'ridiculous idea' criticism
title: Women's FA Cup revamp on hold after 'ridiculous idea' criticism
content: Plans to change the format of the Women's FA Cup, which would have seen four sides seeded and pathways to Wembley mapped out from the last 32 onwards, will not be brought in next season.
